remarks: Lemma for ~ minveco .  Since any two minimal points are distance zero away from each other, the minimal point is unique.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-May-2014.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:

minveco.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. ( ( SubSp ` U ) i^i CBan ) ) $.

minveco.d $e |- D = ( IndMet ` U ) $.

minveco.r $e |- R = ran ( y e. Y |-> ( N ` ( A M y ) ) ) $.
minveco.s $e |- S = sup ( R , RR , `' < ) $.
